question.questionA: Plants up  to 50  cm;  leaves  few,  scarcely  reaching  the  spike;  spike unbranched, three- to ten-flowered.
question.questionB: Plants 50-100 cm; leaves numerous, reaching the spike; spike often branched.

question.questionA: Spikes ten- to thirty-flowered; anthers no longer than filaments; seeds winged.
question.questionB: Spikes six- to sixteen-flowered; anthers longer than filaments; seeds wingless.

question.questionA: Flowers arising directly from the corm.

question.questionB: Perianth segments dissimilar:  the outer erect, the inner spreading and reflexed.

question.questionA: Bracteoles green with a scarious margin.
Upper half of perianth whitish with lilac veins.
question.questionB: Upper half of perianth pure white.

question.questionA: Plants with bulbs covered with fibrous scales.
